terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to access previous versions and manage updates
Standard Operating Procedures - detailed written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks or processes consistently
Software or services that are hosted on remote servers and accessed via the internet rather than installed locally on individual computers
A single, unified location where all documents, files, and data are stored and managed for easy access and organization
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document or project simultaneously with changes visible instantly to all participants
Security measures that determine which users can view, edit, or manage specific documents or system features based on their permissions
The process of generating reports and analytics automatically without manual intervention, often scheduled or triggered by specific events
Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points - a systematic approach to food safety that identifies and controls potential hazards in food production
Good Manufacturing Practices - quality assurance guidelines that ensure products are consistently produced according to quality standards
The process of ensuring that business operations and documentation meet all relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards
An electronic storage system that organizes, preserves, and provides access to digital documents and data
Security configurations that grant or restrict user access to specific features or content based on their assigned roles and privileges
A secure data storage method where files are encoded and stored on remote servers, protecting them from unauthorized access
